headline: Why Vladimir Putin seems to be raising the stakes | World News | Sky News
context: He may not be the one to sit down with Vladimir Putin, but Keith Kellogg, President Trump's special envoy for Ukraine, summed up the horror of Sunday's ballistic missile strikes on Sumy succinctly.
"Today's Palm Sunday attack by Russian forces on civilian targets in Sumy crosses any line of decency," he said.

annotations.paragraph: "As a former military leader, I understand targeting and this is wrong."
annotations.reason: This quote provides direct commentary from a relevant figure, adding context to the situation.

annotations.paragraph: Ukraine war latest: At least 34 people killed
annotations.reason: This provides a factual update on the situation, contributing to the narrative.

annotations.paragraph: Vladimir Putin gave up on decency long before he started this war.
annotations.reason: This is a vague generalization that does not add new information or context.

annotations.paragraph: What he seems to be risking by attacks of this scale is Donald Trump's patience.
annotations.reason: This is speculative and does not provide concrete information or context.

annotations.paragraph: Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player
annotations.reason: This is an unrelated technical note and does not contribute to the article's core story.

annotations.paragraph: He does not seem to mind if strikes like this make a mockery of US attempts to bring the two warring parties to the table.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides insight into Putin's disregard for diplomatic efforts, relevant to the article's focus on his actions.

annotations.paragraph: He does not seem to care if he alienates his US counterpart, who has been strangely predisposed to fawn over him to date.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers context on Putin's relationship with the US, relevant to the article's theme.

annotations.paragraph: Perhaps he is raising the stakes as high as he can to illustrate his strength of hand: Strikes on civilians damage Ukrainian morale - even if they are hardly battlefield wins - and on the battlefield, he is pushing ahead and does not want to stop.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides analysis on Putin's potential strategy, directly related to the article's premise.

annotations.paragraph: Perhaps he knows that if he keeps up his military momentum, President Trump will tire of a conflict he realises he cannot solve and let the matter slip while staying true to his MAGA-economic priorities by letting funds for Ukraine dry up.
annotations.reason: This paragraph speculates on the potential impact of Putin's actions on US policy, relevant to the article's focus.

annotations.paragraph: Perhaps he thinks President Trump is so keen on a rapprochement with Russia, on the big Putin-Trump bilateral, that the details, the civilian deaths along the way, will all be by-the-by when that long-sought photo-op finally happens.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides speculative analysis on Trump's motivations, relevant to the article's theme.

annotations.paragraph: Whatever it is, President Putin seems to be in no rush to get things settled.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a general observation about Putin's approach without specific details.

annotations.paragraph: His spokesman told a Russian state reporter on Sunday that talks were under way at several levels but that "of course, it is impossible to expect any instant results".
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides direct commentary from Putin's spokesman about the status of talks.

annotations.paragraph: Withdrawing his troops would get instant results. But that is not what Vladimir Putin wants.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers insight into Putin's intentions and strategy.

annotations.paragraph: Read more:The art of doing a deal with Trump2025 'critical year' for Ukraine, warns official
annotations.reason: This paragraph is an unrelated promotional link and does not contribute to the main story.

annotations.paragraph: His war economy is working for him, and he has the attention of the one country he considers a worthy adversary, the United States.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about Putin's motivations and geopolitical strategy.

annotations.paragraph: In the meantime, this attack reinforces why President Zelenskyy's plea for air defence systems is his top priority. And why a ceasefire cannot come soon enough.
annotations.reason: The paragraph provides context on the implications of the attack and its impact on Ukraine's defense priorities.
